Issues.Title: Remove SubComponent

This PR builds on top of #817, so the first commit can be reviewed on that PR.

Issues.Title: TensorFlowScorer in ML.NET does not support input tensor of unknown shape
Issues.Body:
Using Microsoft.ML 0.5.0
Yael told me she's already working on a PR to fix this issue. üëç 

**Issue/Bug:** 
We‚Äôd like to extend your test case TensorFlowTransformCifarLearningPipelineTest for making a demo, but instead of loading your ‚Äúcifar‚Äù frozen model, we‚Äôll be using an inception model trained for imagenet (downloaded from https://storage.googleapis.com/download.tensorflow.org/models/inception5h.zip  ).

The main issue is that when executing the Train method of the pipeline, we get an error related to the initialization of the TensorFlowScorer, which I believe is related with using an input tensor of unknown shape. 

Details of the bug/issue are below, but the main question is if we‚Äôll be able to use an input tensor of unknown shape.
 
var shape = tfShapes[i].ToIntArray().Skip(tfShapes[i][0] == -1 ? BatchSize : 0)

Former code is executed in the method TensorFlowMapper.GetInputMetaData(). tfShapes[i] is an object of type TFShape; if the shape is unknown, accessing by the indexer to the first dimension ( tfSfapes[i][0] ) throws a null exception. I checked that most of the methods in TFShape have a guard condition on dims == null, but the overridden indexer doesn‚Äôt have this guard, what could be the culprit of the NullReferenceException

But even if you fix the indexer, then the method tfShapes[i].ToIntArray() it will return null for an unknown tensor, so this will throw again an exception.

Full source code of the demo (and the crash) is available here:
https://github.com/CESARDELATORRE/TensorFlowMLNETSamples/blob/master/src/TensorFlowMLNETInceptionv3ModelScoring/Program.cs
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "TensorFlowScorer in ML.NET does not support input tensor of unknown shape " (#848)

Issues.Title: The file [frozen_model.pb] is missing in the repo
Issues.Body:
### Issue

- **What did you do?** 
I'm trying to run the test [ machinelearning/test/Microsoft.ML.Tests/Scenarios/TensorflowTests.cs]

- **What happened?** 
It seems that I need the file [var model_location = "cifar_model/frozen_model.pb"] and it's not in the repo.

- **What did you expect?**
I can't train the sample test pipeline without the TensorFlow frozen model.

Any guidance or help?

Thanks
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "The file [frozen_model.pb] is missing in the repo" (#839)

Issues.Title: Train operation should be cancellable.
Issues.Body:
### System information

- **OS version/distro**: All supported
- **.NET Version (eg., dotnet --info)**: All supported.

### Issue

- I attempt to write training of the models using API as part of internal pipeline
- After I run `pipeline.Train()` I was not able to stop training using standard .NET CancellationToken API
- Please provide ability to cancel such long running operation as training.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Train operation should be cancellable." (#844)

Issues.Title: Statically Typed Normalizer Estimators
Issues.Body:
Related to #632, with normalizers being put into the PiGSTy. This is relatively straightforward.

On thing which may not be obvious is the grouping of the mean-var/CDF/log-mean-var/log-CDF normalization functions.

* In the "dynamic" land, mean-var/CDF are grouped, and log-mean-var/log-CDF are grouped.
* In the "static" land, mean-var/log-mean-var, and CDF/log-CDF are grouped.

The former grouping appeared to have been motivated by the fact that the training procedures resembled each other. However in static typed land, what matters more is what the *result* of that training will be, and in mean-var it is always an affine normalizer, and in CDF (whether log-CDF or not) it is a CDF normalizer. For `onFit` to have a sensible signature I must therefore split it up according to that criteria.

Also even though it is not quite efficient now, I feel like exposing the "guts" of things might be aided longterm by shifting what we can to use `ImmutableArray<>`. Not sure though.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Statically Typed Normalizer Estimators" (#843)

Issues.Title: Modified official build yaml file to also push to VSTS's artifacts tab
Issues.Body:
Fixes #483.

I based my change on [the old version](https://github.com/dotnet/machinelearning/commit/436700aadf615e7f05a22925476cc441c63a919d#diff-fd7f6e99583f511aa0a2af1c74d32620L148) of the file which pushed to the VSTS feed only. In order to keep pushing to MyGet and also push to VSTS I added a new task to the yaml file. The task is identical to what was found in the old version of the file. 

However, I don't know how to test this code and make sure that it works.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Modified official build yaml file to also push to VSTS's artifacts tab" (#842)

Issues.Title: SDCA Regression and BinaryClassification Pigsty extensions
Issues.Body:
Related to the closed #632 and the API overall. In here I introduce extensions for SDCA regression and binary classification. (No multiclass until I also write extensions for term.)

This also includes a sort of general purpose utilities for writing reconcilers for trainers, though, again, only regression, binary classification, and binary classification without probabilities so far.

Also a minor change to the linear classification trainer, as it was not identifying that it was producing probabilities sometimes.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "SDCA Regression and BinaryClassification Pigsty extensions" (#837)

Issues.Title: The "Area" should not be provided as input when predicting a GitHub issue's label/area
Issues.Body:
https://github.com/dotnet/machinelearning/blob/f89908708f81ae28ad23c7574d405c525ce61b62/test/Microsoft.ML.Tests/Scenarios/Api/AspirationalExamples.cs#L124

I don't think the "area" (such as "area-System.Net") should be provided as input data when predicting the GitHub issue label/area because that is precisely what we want to predict. 

The input data to provide when predicting in this case should just be:
- Issue ID
- Issue name/title
- Issue description
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "The "Area" should not be provided as input when predicting a GitHub issue's label/area" (#841)

Issues.Title: TensorFlow estimator
Issues.Body: Converts TensorFlow transform to estimator/transformer + tests for them
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "TensorFlow estimator" (#840)

Issues.Title: Make TextFeaturizer's extractors etc. configurable again
Issues.Body:
#801 is making the parameters default and hardcoded for the following options of Text featurizer:
- Stop word remover (defaults to none)
- Custom term dictionary (defaults to none)
- Word feature extractor (defaults to unigrams)
- Char feature extractor (defaults to 3-char)

Once individual building blocks become estimators, we should bring these parameters back (in a form of estimator for word/char extractor etc.). 

Or maybe we shouldn't, and instead just demonstrate how to compose your version of text transform from the individual building blocks?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Make TextFeaturizer's extractors etc. configurable again" (#838)

Issues.Title: CpuMath Enhancement: Make bound checking of loops in hardware intrinsics more efficient
Issues.Body:
Style changes needed to solve part of https://github.com/dotnet/machinelearning/issues/823

## Details
-  In `src\Microsoft.ML.CpuMath\SseIntrinsics.cs` and `src\Microsoft.ML.CpuMath\AvxIntrinsics.cs`, changing `while (pDstCurrent + 4 <= pDstEnd)` for the loop bound checking into `while (pDstCurrent <= pDstEnd - 4)` to save an instruction (ref: https://github.com/dotnet/machinelearning/pull/668#issuecomment-412121893)
- It may probably be a CoreCLR issue
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "CpuMath Enhancement: Make bound checking of loops in hardware intrinsics more efficient" (#835)

Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "CpuMath Enhancement: Add unit tests for software fallbacks of hardware intrinsics" (#834)

Issues.Title: CpuMath Enhancement: Optimize codegen of inlining in hardware intrinsics APIs
Issues.Body:
Style changes needed to solve part of https://github.com/dotnet/machinelearning/issues/823

## Details
-  (from Intel partners) In the original code of `src\Microsoft.ML.CpuMath\SseIntrinsics.cs`, even though `VectorSum` is inlined, the codegen is not optimized due to register spill and reload. It seems JIT has optimization opportunity over there. Do you mind opening an issue to discuss about it on CoreCLR github repo?

cc: @tannergooding since you might already have addressed this issue.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "CpuMath Enhancement: Optimize codegen of inlining in hardware intrinsics APIs" (#833)

Issues.Title: CpuMath Enhancement: Use FusedMultiplyAdd in hardware intrinsics APIs
Issues.Body:
Style changes needed to solve part of https://github.com/dotnet/machinelearning/issues/823

## Details
-  In `src\Microsoft.ML.CpuMath\SseIntrinsics.cs`, Use `FusedMultiplyAdd` to replace `srcVector = Sse.Multiply(srcVector, scaleVector);` in `AddScaleU`.  It would be part of any AVX related code-work.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "CpuMath Enhancement: Use FusedMultiplyAdd in hardware intrinsics APIs" (#832)

Issues.Title: CpuMath Enhancement: Accelerate loops in hardware intrinsics implementation
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "CpuMath Enhancement: Accelerate loops in hardware intrinsics implementation" (#831)

Issues.Title: CpuMath Enhancement: Preamble for hardware intrinsics implementation
Issues.Body:
Style changes needed to solve part of https://github.com/dotnet/machinelearning/issues/823

## Details
-  Do "preamble" for the implementation of SSE/AVX intrinsics in `src\Microsoft.ML.CpuMath\SseIntrinsics.cs` and `src\Microsoft.ML.CpuMath\AvxIntrinsics.cs`:

[Preamble](https://github.com/dotnet/coreclr/blob/b896dd14830b600043a99c2626ea848ad679fb4f/src/System.Private.CoreLib/shared/System/SpanHelpers.Char.cs#L96-L102): 
1. while (!aligned) { do scalar operation; } // preamble
2. Do vectorized operation using Read**Aligned**
3. while (!end) { do scalar operation; }
For large arrays, especially those that cross cache line or page boundaries, doing this should save some measurable amount of time. 

Reference: https://github.com/dotnet/machinelearning/pull/562/files/f0f81a5019a3c8cbd795a970e40d633e9e1770c1#r204061074
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "CpuMath Enhancement: Preamble for hardware intrinsics implementation" (#830)

Issues.Title: CpuMath Enhancement: Fix naming of non-constant privates in perf tests for hardware intrinsics
Issues.Body:
Style changes needed to solve part of https://github.com/dotnet/machinelearning/issues/823

## Details
-  In `test\Microsoft.ML.CpuMath.PerformanceTests\PerformanceTests.cs`, regarding the line `private float[] src, dst, original, src1, src2;`, all these **non-constant privates** should be prefixed with `_` but it can be updated in the future PR.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "CpuMath Enhancement: Fix naming of non-constant privates in perf tests for hardware intrinsics" (#829)

Issues.Title: CpuMath Enhancement: Add Debug.Assert to check matching lengths of arguments to SSE/AVX intrinsics
Issues.Body:
Style changes needed to solve part of https://github.com/dotnet/machinelearning/issues/823

## Details
-  In `src\Microsoft.ML.CpuMath\SseIntrinsics.cs`, it may make sense to add some `Debug.Asserts` to check the `src` and `dst` Lengths match. However, these are internal functions that are only called from functions that guarantee the arguments are checked, so it might not be a blocking issue. It just may be some nice documentation on the expectations of these methods. And in case they get new callsites in the future.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "CpuMath Enhancement: Add Debug.Assert to check matching lengths of arguments to SSE/AVX intrinsics" (#828)

Issues.Title: CpuMath Enhancement: Remove any unnecessary Contracts.Assert covered by Span<T> in hardware intrinsics APIs
Issues.Body:
Style changes needed to solve part of https://github.com/dotnet/machinelearning/issues/823

## Details
-  In `src\Microsoft.ML.CpuMath\CpuMathUtils.netcoreapp.cs`, `Span<T>` might already do the checks (`Contracts.Assert`) in the public functions.  Reference:
https://github.com/dotnet/machinelearning/blob/e443e2afcd39a8a363321d423e087c0569c0d4af/src/Microsoft.ML.CpuMath/CpuMathUtils.netcoreapp.cs#L237-L245
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "CpuMath Enhancement: Remove any unnecessary Contracts.Assert covered by Span<T> in hardware intrinsics APIs" (#827)

Issues.Title: CpuMath Enhancement: Rename input arguments of CpuMath SSE/AVX intrinsics
Issues.Body:
Style changes needed to solve part of https://github.com/dotnet/machinelearning/issues/823

## Details
- Rename input arguments of methods in `src\Microsoft.ML.CpuMath\CpuMathUtils.netcoreapp.cs` and `src\Microsoft.ML.CpuMath\Sse.cs`, to make them more informative, e.g.:
* for `MatTimesSrc`, change `tran` into `transpose`

* for `a` and `b`, change them into `src` and `dst`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "CpuMath Enhancement: Rename input arguments of CpuMath SSE/AVX intrinsics" (#824)
